result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Alexander Butler

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Alexander Butler in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for James Alexander Butler.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court status. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned. Case remains calendared in 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Justice Point Discharge Report, filed. Forwarded to Judge for review.

JusticePoint PreTrial Services Status Report dated August 31, 2022; received and filed.
Missed Scheduled Alternate Contact.

Defendant James Alexander Butler in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  James Alexander Butler appeared by video means with Attorney.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case heard via ZOOM.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time to review case.  Case remains calendared in Branch 15.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kohl's Department Store.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant James Alexander Butler in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant James Alexander Butler in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  James Alexander Butler appeared by video means with Attorney. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge J.D. Watts, Branch 15.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15 for pretrial conference.  
This hearing MAY be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/104d9737-ba2f-8811-9083-aed2135824d9.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
